skill.description: Automatically creates user-facing changelogs from git commits by analyzing commit history, categorizing changes, and transforming technical commits into clear, customer-friendly release notes. Turns hours of manual changelog writing into minutes of automated generation.

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no external command execution. This skill provides only documentation, guidelines, and usage examples for generating changelogs.

content.user_title: Generate customer-friendly changelogs from git history
content.value_statement: Manually writing changelogs from git commits is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automatically scans commit history, categorizes changes into logical groups, and transforms technical developer language into clear, customer-friendly release notes that users can actually understand.
actual_capabilities: Scans git commit history from specific time periods or version tags
Categorizes commits into features, improvements, bug fixes, breaking changes, and security updates
Translates technical commit messages into user-friendly language
Filters out internal-only commits like refactoring and test changes
Creates professionally formatted markdown changelog entries
Applies changelog best practices and brand voice guidelines
limitations: Does not directly execute git commands - works with AI assistance to interpret and format commits
Requires user to run from a git repository with clean commit history
Output quality depends on the clarity of original commit messages
Does not auto-publish to external platforms - generates content for manual posting

use_cases.title: Release Documentation
use_cases.description: Prepare polished changelogs for software releases, app store submissions, and GitHub releases.

use_cases.title: Customer Update Summaries
use_cases.description: Create clear, concise update notifications for customers that explain what changed and why it matters.

use_cases.title: Documentation Automation
use_cases.description: Automate the tedious process of converting commit logs into maintainable changelog documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Changelog
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a changelog from commits since the last release tag

prompt_templates.title: Date Range Filter
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a changelog for all commits between March 1 and March 15, 2024

prompt_templates.title: Version-Based
prompt_templates.prompt: Create release notes for version 2.5.0, comparing with v2.4.0

prompt_templates.title: Custom Guidelines
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a changelog for commits since v2.4.0, using my changelog guidelines from CHANGELOG_STYLE.md

output_examples.input: Create a changelog for commits from the past 7 days
output: - **Team Workspaces**: Create separate workspaces for different projects. Invite team members and keep everything organized.
- **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Press ? to see all available shortcuts. Navigate faster without touching your mouse.
- **Faster Sync**: Files now sync 2x faster across devices
- **Better Search**: Search now includes file contents, not just titles
- Fixed issue where large images would not upload
- Resolved timezone confusion in scheduled posts

best_practices: Run from your git repository root with clean commit history for best results
Provide a CHANGELOG_STYLE.md file for consistent formatting and brand voice
Review and edit the generated changelog before publishing to ensure accuracy
anti_patterns: Using vague commit messages that lack context about user impact
Skipping the review step - generated changelogs need human verification
Including internal commits like refactoring, tests, or chore changes

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude Code and other Claude-powered tools. Check compatibility with your specific AI assistant.

faq.question: What commit message format works best?
faq.answer: Conventional commits with clear, descriptive messages work best. Include context about user impact when possible.

faq.question: Can I customize the output format?
faq.answer: Yes. Provide a CHANGELOG_STYLE.md file with your formatting guidelines, brand voice, and category preferences.

faq.question: Is my git data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill processes commits locally through your AI assistant. No git data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why are some commits missing from the output?
faq.answer: The skill filters internal commits like refactoring, test updates, and chore changes. Check your commit message quality for better results.

faq.question: How does this compare to automated git tools?
faq.answer: This skill translates technical commits into user-friendly language. Use git release tools for metadata, then this skill for customer-facing content.
